tool_definitions.description:
StrixDB Tools - Permanent GitHub-based Knowledge Repository
These tools allow you to store and retrieve useful artifacts in StrixDB, a permanent GitHub repository. Act as an enthusiastic collector - save scripts, exploits, knowledge, tools, methods, and anything else useful for future security testing engagements.
SIMPLIFIED CONFIGURATION: - Repository is always named "StrixDB" - Only needs STRIXDB_TOKEN (GitHub PAT) to be set - Owner is automatically detected from the token
Default Categories: - scripts: Automation scripts, shell scripts, utilities - exploits: Working exploits and PoCs - knowledge: Security knowledge, research notes, documentation - libraries: Reusable code libraries and modules - sources: Data sources, references, wordlists - methods: Attack methodologies and techniques - tools: Custom security tools - configs: Configuration files and templates - wordlists: Custom wordlists for fuzzing - payloads: Useful payloads for attacks - templates: Report and code templates - notes: Quick notes and findings
NEW: You can create custom categories using strixdb_create_category()!

tool.name: strixdb_create_category
tool.description:
Create a NEW custom category in StrixDB.
Use this when existing categories don't fit your content. The category will be created immediately and is ready for use.
Examples of custom categories you might create: - mobile_exploits: Mobile app security exploits - api_attacks: API-specific attack techniques - cloud_misconfigs: Cloud misconfiguration findings - forensics: Digital forensics scripts and tools - malware: Malware samples and analysis tools

parameters.parameter: Name for the new category (lowercase, no spaces, underscores OK)
Description of what this category is for

tool.returns: Dictionary with operation result including success status and category info
tool.example: Create a new category for mobile exploits: strixdb_create_category( category_name="mobile_exploits", description="Exploits and PoCs for mobile applications (iOS/Android)" )

tool.name: strixdb_save
tool.description:
Save an item to StrixDB for permanent storage.
Use this to store: - Useful scripts you created or found - Working exploits and PoCs - Security knowledge and notes - Custom tools and utilities - Attack methodologies - Anything else useful for future engagements
Be an enthusiastic collector! If something might be useful later, save it.
NOTE: If the category doesn't exist, it will be created automatically!

parameters.parameter: Category for the item. Can be existing or new category name.
Name of the item (will be sanitized for filename)
Content to save (script, exploit code, knowledge, etc.)
Description of what this item does and when to use it
Tags for categorization and search (e.g., ["sqli", "bypass", "mysql"])
Type of content: text, script, json, python, javascript, yaml, binary Default: text

tool.returns: Dictionary with operation result including success status and item info
tool.example: Save a useful SQL injection bypass technique: strixdb_save( category="exploits", name="mysql_auth_bypass", content="' OR '1'='1' -- ...", description="MySQL authentication bypass using comment injection", tags=["sqli", "mysql", "auth_bypass"] )

tool.name: strixdb_search
tool.description:
Search for items in StrixDB.
Search across names, descriptions, and content to find useful artifacts from previous engagements.

parameters.parameter: Search query (searches name, description, content)
Optional category filter
Optional tags filter (items must have at least one matching tag)
Maximum number of results (default: 20)

tool.returns: Dictionary with search results including item names, categories, and paths
tool.example: Search for SQL injection related items: strixdb_search( query="sql injection", category="exploits", tags=["sqli"] )

tool.name: strixdb_get
tool.description:
Retrieve a specific item from StrixDB.
Use this to get the full content of an item you found via search or know exists from previous use.

parameters.parameter: Category of the item
Name of the item to retrieve

tool.returns: Dictionary with item content and metadata
tool.example: Get a stored exploit: strixdb_get( category="exploits", name="mysql_auth_bypass" )

tool.name: strixdb_list
tool.description:
List items in StrixDB.
Browse available items in a category or across all categories.

parameters.parameter: Category to list (omit for all categories)
Maximum number of items (default: 50)

tool.returns: Dictionary with list of items including names, categories, and paths
tool.example:
List all exploits: strixdb_list(category="exploits")
List all items: strixdb_list()

tool.name: strixdb_update
tool.description:
Update an existing item in StrixDB.
Use this to improve or fix stored items.

parameters.parameter: Category of the item
Name of the item
New content for the item
New description (optional, keeps existing if not provided)
New tags (optional, keeps existing if not provided)

tool.name: strixdb_delete
tool.description:
Delete an item from StrixDB.
Use sparingly - only delete items that are truly obsolete or incorrect.

parameters.parameter: Category of the item
Name of the item to delete

tool.name: strixdb_get_categories
tool.description:
Get all available categories in StrixDB with descriptions and item counts.
Shows both default and custom categories.
tool.returns: Dictionary with category information including names, descriptions, item counts, and whether each is a custom category

tool.name: strixdb_get_config_status
tool.description:
Get the current StrixDB configuration status.
Use this to debug configuration issues or check if StrixDB is properly set up.
tool.returns: Dictionary with configuration status including: - configured: Whether StrixDB is configured - connection_status: Connection test result - repository: Repository path - token_set: Whether token is set - setup_instructions: How to configure if not set up

tool.name: strixdb_get_stats
tool.description: Get statistics about the StrixDB repository.
tool.returns: Dictionary with stats including total items, items per category, size, etc.

tool.name: strixdb_export
tool.description: Export items from StrixDB in JSON or Markdown format.

parameters.parameter: Category to export (omit for all)
Export format: json or markdown (default: json)

tool.name: strixdb_import_item
tool.description: Import an item to StrixDB from a dictionary.

parameters.parameter: Dictionary with item data: category, name, content, description, tags
